intro: Plukenetia chaponensis, commonly known as the Mexican blackberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its prickly stems and small, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into fleshy, orange-red berries. These berries are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor, often used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
